moves.1. g3:
Decided to annotate this game just to show what I'm thinking as I play. I'm an average player and know little about classic opening strategies and I'm often baffled reading 2000+ rated player annotated games. 

g3 opening as plan to fianchetto my Bishop as it's sometimes missed by opponents and can sometimes win the a8 Rook if they're careless.
moves.2... c6: Not sure what my opponent is planning here yet
moves.3. d4: d4 stop further pawn advance by him and to allow my bishop out
moves.4. Bf4: Planning on Bxb8 to deny him castling long
moves.5... e6: Looking at pinning my knight i presume
moves.7. Qd2: In case he plays Bxc3 as I don't want to mess up my pawn structure when taking his Bishop
moves.8. a3: To force his Bishop to move or to trade once I have castled.
moves.8... Ngf6: Eyeing e4 to add pressure to my c3 Knight I think
moves.9. O-O: Done for Kings safety and and so I can take his b4 bishop now.
moves.11. Ra2: a2 as want to stay on open file
moves.11... a6 12. b3: To cover a4 for Rook attack on Queen
moves.13... b5 14. Ne5: Hoping for a Knight trade here as my retake with dxe5 will threaten his f6 Knight
moves.16... Bb7 17. b4: making room for Rook on 3rd rank as planning to get across to f file with it.   This was a mistake I missed at the time I played it as it is an undefended piece.
moves.18... Qxb4: I missed that move as concentrating on my idea too much!
moves.19... Qe7 20. Ne2: Making room for castle to cross board
moves.21. Rb4: Rf3 would have been better here but I rushed the move.
moves.21... a5 22. Rd4: Only safe place without losing my chance to cross the board
moves.22... a4 23. exd5: Making room for Rook to move again. Plan here was to sacrifice Bishop with Bxh6 and hope for gxh6 to expose his King for Rg4+
moves.23... cxd5 24. Bxh6: A sacrifice to hopefully expose his King
moves.25. Bg5: Plan now is to get Bishop to f6 to restrict Kings options
moves.26... Kh7: Kf8 would not have worked any better for him here as Qh6+ would have been my next move. Now Rh4+ has same result though.
moves.27... Kg8 28. Rh8#:
One of my better games where I actually had a plan that came to fruition!

Two mistakes and one blunder according to the computer so a decent game for me.
